"My family tells of an ancient legend about two great dragon brothers -- the dragon of the north wind, and the dragon of the south wind."

This was from an Overwatch cinematic that came out adjacent to the games release. The amount of foreshadowing this would endow in the mind of fans with was unknown at the time, but seems remarkable in hindsight.

There were always two sides (or dragons in this metaphor) within Overwatch -- as there always is in art that has turned into a lucrative business. You have the creatives; those with ambition, drive, passion, and a remarkable ability to sacrifice for the art form they love -- the other, those who wish to exploit and sell the art of others. Those who sell themselves as the logical mind behind the creatives.

"Together, they upheld balance and harmony in the heavens."

For the most part this was true in Overwatch 1. Though they had lootboxes, they contained so much of so little that their purchase was inconsequential. During this period of 2016-2018, creativity was allowed to flourish -- before the balance wasn't so upheld in the blizzard heavens.

"But the two brothers argued over who could better rule their land. Their quarrel turned to rage and their violent struggle darkened the skies until the dragon of the south wind struck down his brother."

From 2019 until overwatch 2 released in November 2022 was when I imagine this struggle happening. Their was silence from the development team. No new content on their new game that was making millions. Devs wanted to create and executives wanted to sell -- resulting in ever-changing goals and no new content for their starving fan base. 

With Overwatch 2 it seems the creatives at Blizzard have finally given up their struggles for artistic freedom and given into the demands of intellectually stunted and churlish businessmen.

"The dragon of the south wind knelt down on the ground and was finally able to see the world around him."

I want this game to succeed. Millions of us do. We love what this game was and what it could be. I want Blizzard to realize their mistakes, become human -- but their gigantic success seems to have severed their ties to the humanity that once defined them.

At the end of the cinematic I've been referencing, the brother who was thought to have been killed came back and faces his brother who killed him, beating him in a duel.  The ending remark of this cutscene perfectly describes my feelings on this game.

The brother who comes back from the dead says to his murderous, evil brother 

"perhaps I am a fool for thinking their is still hope for you -- but I do."

没有任何一款游戏能代替守望先锋，包括守望先锋归来。

Blizzard as a company failed so massively that they should be used as a case study for years to come. The unfortunate thing about OW 2 and the franchise in general, is the potential that was never realized. It's almost like watching a savant rot in jail. It's impossible to put everything into one review, so I will try and break it down into main points and keep it simple. 

[h1] Matchmaking [/h1]
Absolutely terrible. The worst part about it being so bad is the fact that it's a FPS game and fundamental to the experience. I've never played a game that has gotten it so wrong before. 

[h1] Content [/h1]
The game launched with less content than the original game had. If you want content that is generated, prepare to face their price gouging. 

[h1] Bugs and Servers [/h1]
Here's a huge one. I can't list all of the bugs, but the fact you have to re-apply settings almost every time you enter the video part of the UI is insane. Servers are not consistent, latency is up and down, and the feel of the game can get really choppy depending on server performance

[h1] Competitive [/h1]
God awful. Not rewarding. Not satisfying. Not even. Not fun. Pathetic, sad, egregious

[h1] Overall [/h1]
The current leadership took an amazing game, with infinite potential, and ran it into the ground. The best part of OW in its current state is the animated shorts. The original story and those who maintain it's unique appeal are the only good thing left about this game. I hope that one day all of the current leadership is fired and that they can salvage what has been lost, but in the age of greed over quality, it's not worth holding out the hope.

The core gameplay is pretty fun, but the game has become a hollow shell of what it once was. This game is run by a greedy and creepy company who abandoned the game to "work on a PvE story mode" for years before completely scrapping the whole thing and is now charging 15 dollars per story mission. Back then, everyone could play a new character on release for FREE. Since this is now a live service game, you have to pay for a battlepass every 2 months to play a new character. You *can* unlock the character after the season ends, but the character will most likely be neutered compared to how they were during the season they debuted. Blizzard does not listen to their community. When it comes to balance changes, they do the complete opposite of what needs to be done. The game is highly frustrating in a competitive standpoint, especially if you don't purchase the battlepass to unlock the season's new and overpowered character. Until Blizzard can get their act together, stay away from this game and go play another Hero Shooter/Class-Based shooter.

In all the history of human kind no piece of entertainment media is worse than this "game". No other feat of man has been more evil and as much of a cardinal sin than this. The heathenish developers of this game are in collusion with the lizard men, the giants, and all the other bastard sons of Satan. One day, these heathens will come before God and they will be forced to tell him their sins.

《这个世界不需要守望先锋》

垃圾游戏狗都不玩

守望先锋真的超好玩，我从守望1的开服就开始玩，从他开服到去年（2022），我每天闲暇时间几乎都是它，每年过年都是守望先锋里跟朋友一起度过的。
画面好，优化好，剧情好，人设好，技能好，UI好，音效好。
我觉得守望几乎没有缺点。
他开场就是那一年游戏界的天！！！
以前还有几个想跟风做这个类型的，全都被他的优秀压下去了。
然后呢，他就没了，再也没出现了。

归来是什么垃圾游戏，套着守望的皮，搞的乱七八糟。
5v5？我们本来优秀的6v6机制不用，想着抄别人游戏的机制？过去凑好的6黑小队直接被迫缺席一人
然后游戏免费制，商城改版，箱子移除。
外挂成本降低，英雄、皮肤成本增加，奖励机制减少。
从最单纯的快乐，变成令人作呕的逼氪。

守望1里，我买了5个号，并且可以更多，一个自己玩，其他为了传教，带朋友或者给朋友体验。但是归来里，我要是充过一分钱都是我输。

在微软收购完成、守望变好之前这条评论不改。

Since 2016 so far, very thankful that Blizzard officials can finally leave a piece of the game can be evaluated by the players after 7 years after the release of the game, I do not know whether Blizzard understands what is called stubborn, but I think the arrogance of teaching players to play the game has made Blizzard eat its own fruits, if the plummeting number of players and cold ratings of the league still can not make it realize its own mistakes, it can only be I wish Blizzard all the best for the future.
          There's no doubt Overwatch is a great game across the ages, with an art style, accompanying music and novel gameplay that is nothing short of enjoyable. But if the game is the best game out there right now, the planning has to be the worst ever, and Blizzard amply demonstrated what it means to be dealt A good hand of cards played badly. and after a brief period of summer 2016 fun, Overwatch began its own descent all the way downhill.
          First of all, it is the slow update speed, after a short period of hero update, the design and production cycle of new heroes became longer and longer, from the initial quarterly Ana, Sombra to the later yearly Sigma, echo, and after the echo update up to three years have not launched any new heroes, it is true that the Overwatch development team frankly said early that echo would be the last new hero of Overwatch, and then will move the development focus on Overwatch 2, however, after three years Overwatch2 is a half-baked product with frequent bugs, changes for the sake of change, and a big cut in PVE. Simply put, Overwatch as a MOBA elements of high content of the game, timely hero update is needed and necessary, the number of heroes and the number of maps from the fundamental constraints on the game's repeatability and tactical development, which is the key to the Overwatch late league mirror lineup.
          The second is the extremely outrageous balancing, the early hero multi-select, to the later one team single-select, to the final mandatory 222 duty lock, each of which is an attempt to salvage their own chaotic balancing, and all of which use a one-size-fits-all strategy, forcing players to play the game according to their own ideas and thoughts. And in addition to these several entire subversion of the game play of the great balance, each version of the hero patch is speechless, in addition to the common knead dough balance, the value of repeated horizontal jumps, according to the hero appearance rate and win rate of brainless weakening, according to the level of the top players of the league reference to weaken the heroes and other conventional operations, even if this version of the weakening of heroes in the next version of the next version of the completely inappropriate, he was directly forgotten, and instead of weakening the strong heroes in this version of the strong heroes, do not understand what the callback is, resulting in the final state of all the heroes all weak. Especially the heroes of the auxiliary column, none of the auxiliary has escaped the clutches of the nerf, itself auxiliary heroes are less, the game experience is not high, and now directly forced players to change positions or quit the game. Then there are some heroes in the weakening after the tragic forgettable, even if it has been a year have not seen any changes to the hero, and the official reason is the plan to redo it, but this is obviously not an excuse for forgettable. Of course, aside from the general environment of repeatedly jumping across the board and nerfing all the time, the new hero's supermodel streak of cuts and too weak streak of increases doesn't seem so critical.
          And the most important point, is itself as an entertainment-oriented game, stubborn to try to e-sports, here is not to say that e-sports is not good, but Blizzard can not find the balance between the ordinary players and e-sports competition, in order to improve the spectacle of e-sports and sacrifice the ordinary players of the playing experience itself is to give up the end of the world, has been for the sake of ornamental and the choice of lineups for human intervention, and even appeared in the official ban The farce of specific hero maps has led to a massive loss of player groups and the imminent dissolution of the league, which is not worth the loss.
          Of course all of the above suggestions are for the game Overwatch, not talking about the turd that is Overwatch2. After Overwatch officially closes in 2022, you'll only be able to play the crap sequel Overwatch2, and if Overwatch only had a handful of flaws, Overwatch2 completely turned all the remaining good points into flaws.
          The first is the game's reward system, where other games are encouraging raffle prizes, Overwatch 2 has surprisingly gone the other way, marking all skins available to the player as cash purchases, with the event rewards that the player can get for free through their efforts being of purple and lower quality, and the subsequent addition of silver coins only allowing them to purchase a handful of old skins from the ancient era of Overwatch, and still hiked up in price. 
          Apparently, the game's matching mechanism is also one of the reasons why countless players are angry. The game will force players with very different skill levels to be your teammates after a winning streak in order to maintain their win rate at around 50%, and sometimes it doesn't even feel like humans are being your teammates. Overwatch, in turn, is a game and its need for cooperation, and the shortcomings in a team directly determine the highest level of a team, and this is especially evident in Overwatch 2. Even if you do all the duties of your position well, and even help the other positions share some of the tasks, the team's shortcomings will still invalidate all your previous efforts, giving you a huge sense of frustration and powerlessness.
          Second is the design of the activities, abandoned the previous large-scale activities, instead of each season set up a few small activities, the quality of these small activities is hard to say, and even some of them are directly from the map workshop to make up the number, although the old activities are repeated every year, but the volume and the degree of intent is not Overwatch2 can be compared at all.
          Lastly, the most criticized change for the sake of change in Overwatch 2, in order to reflect that it is a new game, it cuts out all the previously perfected UI, firepower, and lineups, and forcibly changes the lineups to 5V5. I understand that the original intention of the change was to reduce queue time, but the tanking position is now completely guessing gameplay, which is extremely formulaic and boring. Furthermore, it's replacing all of Overwatch's distinctive UI with a simple, ugly UI that's just like the internal beta, just to show that there are official changes being made. The experience bar, firepower, and other things that enhance the player's experience were all removed, and although they've all been added back now, it's clearly not a reason for the devs to waste their time.
          And similar to the gesture system and weapon review is completely shadow, not to mention before boasting the most powerful talent system PVE has been announced big cut, three years to do PVE results finally told the players that they can not do it, only a copy of a rudimentary Overwatch2 still have to Overwatch shutdown, really don't understand how the development group has the face to say this sentence.
          To summarize, Overwatch 2 is a complete failure, not only is it difficult for newcomers to get started, but it's also hard to get into the game and still be oppressed by the planners, so it's recommended that new players don't easily try this game in order to bring haze to their good life.

This game was a fucking mistake. If you're looking for a game that will absolutely disrespect you and your time, this is it. Also, Blizzard is filled with child molesters.

We all know this game's only real purpose for its existence is the porn.
